text: Speech & Debate is a 2017 American film directed by Dan Harris. The film is an adaptation of the play of the same name and was released on April 7, 2017, by Vertical Entertainment. == Premise == The film features three misfit students in high school who are frustrated with the hypocrisy they see in their parents and school staff. Together, they try to revive an extinct school debate club to face the situation they are in. == Cast == * Liam James as Solomon * Sarah Steele as Diwata * Austin P. McKenzie as Howie * Roger Bart as Principal Bellingham * Janeane Garofalo as Marie * Wendi McLendon-Covey as Joan * Kal Penn as James * Kimberly Williams-Paisley as Susan * Skylar Astin as Walter Healy * Lin-Manuel Miranda as The Genie * Ryan Lee as Mark * Darren Criss as himself * Lucy DeVito as Lucy * Sarah Baker as Ms. Riggi * Lester Speight as Scary Bouncer * Jeremy Rowley as Gary Crenshaw == Production == Principal photography started in August 8, 2015 in Jackson, Mississippi, United States. "When Stephen Karam Couldn't Get Cast, He Found 'Speech & Debate'" Playbill, February 4, 2017 The song "Losers Are Winners", which was written by Karam, is played over the credits performed by Kristin Chenoweth. ==Release and reception== The film was released on April 7, 2017, by Vertical Entertainment. On review aggregator Rotten Tomatoes, the film holds an approval rating of 55% based on 11 reviews, with an average rating of 6.4/10.
